intro: Dungsia brevicaulis, commonly known as the short-stemmed dungsia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions with cool, moist conditions, often in rocky or alpine environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are usually white or pale green, adding a delicate touch to its habitat. Dungsia brevicaulis is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
